description:
**Fix Overview**:

To address the Windows kernel elevation of privilege vulnerability identified as CVE-2024-21443:

1. Download and apply the relevant updates from the Microsoft Update Catalog, based on your system's build number.
   - For Windows 11 Version 23H2 for x64-based Systems: Apply KB5035853. 
   - For Windows 11 Version 22H2 for x64-based Systems: Apply KB5035853.
   - For Windows 11 Version 21H2 for x64-based Systems: Apply KB5035854.
   - For Windows 10 Version 22H2 for x64-based Systems: Apply KB5035845.
   - For Windows 10 Version 21H2 for x64-based Systems: Apply KB5035845.
   - For Windows 10 Version 22H2 for 32-bit Systems: Apply KB5035845.
   - For Windows 10 Version 21H2 for 32-bit Systems: Apply KB5035845.

2. Restart your system after installation to ensure changes take effect.

**Details**:
This update resolves a critical kernel vulnerability that could allow an attacker to gain elevated privileges. The updates are accessible via the Microsoft Update Catalog: 
- [KB5035845](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5035845)
- [KB5035853](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5035853)
- [KB5035854](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5035854).

**Preconditions**:
- Ensure that you are on an affected build version of Windows.
- Backup critical data before proceeding with the installation.
